title: 108_hr5182
content: The Homeland Security Civil Rights and Civil Liberties Protection Act of 2004 ensures that civil rights and liberties are not compromised in efforts to secure the homeland. It also establishes an Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties within the Department of Homeland Security. Section 705(a) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to ensure that the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties reports directly to the Secretary, addresses concerns on race, ethnicity, and religion profiling, and oversees compliance with constitutional and statutory requirements. Additionally, the Officer is tasked with assisting in developing and reviewing policies to protect civil rights and civil liberties within Department programs and activities. The Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties oversees compliance with various requirements related to civil rights and civil liberties, coordinates with other officials to address these issues comprehensively, and investigates complaints of possible abuses unless determined otherwise by the Inspector General. SEC. 4. PROTECTION OF CIVIL RIGHTS AND CIVIL LIBERTIES BY OFFICE OF INSPECTOR GENERAL. Designation and Functions of Senior Official amended to include oversight of civil rights and civil liberties. The Inspector General of the Department of Homeland Security designates a senior official to coordinate investigations of abuses of civil rights and civil liberties within the department and its contractors or grantees. The senior official is responsible for receiving complaints, reviewing information, and initiating investigations into alleged abuses. The Inspector General of the Department of Homeland Security designates a senior official to coordinate investigations of abuses of civil rights and civil liberties within the department and its contractors or grantees. The official ensures personnel receive training for effective investigations, consults with the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties, provides information on investigation outcomes, refers matters not investigated to the Officer, and publicizes information for convenient access. The Inspector General designates a senior official to coordinate investigations of civil rights and civil liberties abuses within the Department of Homeland Security. The official ensures personnel receive training for effective investigations, consults with the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties, provides information on investigation outcomes, and publicizes access to complaints and investigation status. Additionally, any weaknesses or deficiencies related to civil rights or civil liberties within the Department should be reported to the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to include a Privacy Officer who reports directly to the Secretary. The Privacy Officer coordinates with the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties to ensure integrated and comprehensive handling of programs, policies, and procedures related to civil rights, civil liberties, and privacy considerations. The Congress receives appropriate reports on these matters.
